content.description: Sit start on jugs in the middle of the roof and follow the good rail out left and up the face.The first recorded accent of this problem gave it V4 but is has been incorrectly listed as V7 in the notoriously unreliable Chatt Bloc guidebook.
content.location: The second roof on your right after you pass through the Forty Five boulder. The problem is just to the left of the small seasonal creek.

content.description: Start at the far right edge of the 45 degree overhang. Traverse into the start of the left problem and climbed it without the pedestal. This is commonly done as a hang and drop but I believe it is possible to top out as well.This problem is incorrectly called Trav 45 in Chatt Bloc
content.location: On the 45 degree overhanging face where the trail passes between two boulders.

content.description: Start at the base of the left hanging corner feature at the back of the roof. Follow this feature out the roof, then traverse slightly left before getting established on the face. Top out. Traversing in from the blocky jug on the right adds some butt-dragging moves and a little bit of pump.
content.location: On the left side of the long, flat cave just left of OPP. Spotted from the main 45 boulder by looking right along the cliff.

content.description: A little past the main area is another small cluster of boulders. The main boulder has a couple steep problems that can stay dry in light rain. There are also a few low roofs.
